verses.verse: A Psalm of David.<WH1732> The LORD<WH3068> is my light<WH216> and my salvation;<WH3468> whom<WH4480> <WH4310> shall I fear?<WH3372> the LORD<WH3068> is the strength<WH4581> of my life;<WH2416> of whom<WH4480> <WH4310> shall I be afraid?<WH6342>
When the wicked,<WH7489> even mine enemies<WH6862> and my foes,<WH341> came<WH7126> upon<WH5921> me to eat up<WH398> <WH853> my flesh,<WH1320> they<WH1992> stumbled<WH3782> and fell.<WH5307>

Though <WH518> a host<WH4264> should encamp<WH2583> against<WH5921> me, my heart<WH3820> shall not<WH3808> fear:<WH3372> though<WH518> war<WH4421> should rise<WH6965> against<WH5921> me, in this<WH2063> will I<WH589> be confident.<WH982>

One <WH259> thing have I desired<WH7592> of<WH4480> <WH854> the LORD,<WH3068> that will I seek after;<WH1245> that I may dwell<WH3427> in the house<WH1004> of the LORD<WH3068> all<WH3605> the days<WH3117> of my life,<WH2416> to behold<WH2372> the beauty<WH5278> of the LORD,<WH3068> and to inquire<WH1239> in his temple.<WH1964>

For <WH3588> in the time<WH3117> of trouble<WH7451> he shall hide<WH6845> me in his pavilion:<WH5520> in the secret<WH5643> of his tabernacle<WH168> shall he hide<WH5641> me; he shall set me up<WH7311> upon a rock.<WH6697>

And now<WH6258> shall mine head<WH7218> be lifted up<WH7311> above<WH5921> mine enemies<WH341> round about<WH5439> me: therefore will I offer<WH2076> in his tabernacle<WH168> sacrifices<WH2077> of joy;<WH8643> I will sing,<WH7891> yea, I will sing praises<WH2167> unto the LORD.<WH3068>
Hear, <WH8085> O LORD,<WH3068> when I cry<WH7121> with my voice:<WH6963> have mercy<WH2603> also upon me, and answer<WH6030> me.
When thou saidst, Seek<WH1245> ye my face;<WH6440> my heart<WH3820> said<WH559> unto thee,<WH853> Thy face,<WH6440> LORD,<WH3068> will I seek.<WH1245>

Hide <WH5641> not<WH408> thy face<WH6440> far from<WH4480> me; put not thy servant away<WH5186> <WH408> <WH5650> in anger:<WH639> thou hast been<WH1961> my help;<WH5833> leave<WH5203> me not,<WH408> neither<WH408> forsake<WH5800> me, O God<WH430> of my salvation.<WH3468>
When <WH3588> my father<WH1> and my mother<WH517> forsake<WH5800> me, then the LORD<WH3068> will take me up.<WH622>
Teach <WH3384> me thy way,<WH1870> O LORD,<WH3068> and lead<WH5148> me in a plain<WH4334> path,<WH734> because of<WH4616> mine enemies.<WH8324>

Deliver <WH5414> me not<WH408> over unto the will<WH5315> of mine enemies:<WH6862> for<WH3588> false<WH8267> witnesses<WH5707> are risen up<WH6965> against me, and such as breathe out<WH3307> cruelty.<WH2555>
I had fainted, unless<WH3884> I had believed<WH539> to see<WH7200> the goodness<WH2898> of the LORD<WH3068> in the land<WH776> of the living.<WH2416>
Wait <WH6960> on<WH413> the LORD:<WH3068> be of good courage,<WH2388> and he shall strengthen<WH553> thine heart:<WH3820> wait,<WH6960> I say, on<WH413> the LORD.<WH3068>
